title: Casework
text:
Led a mission-critical workstream in moving India’s financial processes to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (D365 F&O). Directed simplification and reduction in general ledger (GL) mappings with introduction of standardized master data principles in cost centers, legal entities, and reporting segments. This initiative improved financial data accuracy significantly, reduced reconciliation time by an appreciable percentage, and improved reporting accuracy by 15%. Worked very closely with various cross-functional groups including IT, regional controllers, and global ERP experts to enable smooth implementation, user preparedness, and change management. The project laid grounds for future automation and global standardization for finance.




Over the course of my internship, I created and implemented a centralized budget tracking system for the editorial department to meet an existing need for cost reporting and management. The solution fused disparate data feeds into a single integrated and user-friendly platform that facilitated real-time tracking of project expenditure. Budget authorization and reconciliation processing time were reduced by 25% as a result and accountability among editorial teams improved through greater transparency and defined budget ownership. I collaborated with editorial management and finance staff to design reporting parameters and developed automated classification rules to ensure accuracy and consistency. The system was embraced by senior management as a best practice model across other departments and as a springboard for additional electronic process improvement.

title: Leadership & Community Impact
text:
🌟 My Approach to Leadership
Leadership isn’t a title, but a foundation of trust, a drive for action, and problem-solving with purpose. Whether I am working to transform systems or supporting a colleague, I seek to lead by working together, by talking, and by making things clear.
Leadership involves influencing, not directing.



💼 Leadership in Action – ERP Coordination
At Hellmann Worldwide Logistics, where I did my internship, I was involved in a full country rollout of Microsoft Dynamics 365. Although I did not have an official leadership position, I:
Worked together with all cities’ finance teams - Improved processes for performing user testing and training team members Provided support in intercompany coordination among regional subsidiaries
Through this action, I practiced leadership without formal authority and established trust in team communication and problem-solving.



👥Peer Support and Mentorship

At Outlook India, I assisted in training the other interns on learning reporting processes and Excel automation.
I provide informal mentoring to undergraduate business students through LinkedIn resume critiques, career counsel, and interview coaching.

These experiences taught me about being gentle and how to be a leader in quiet but strong ways.



❤️ Community Engagement






Member – Lions Club International - Organized intercollege quizzes and debate competitions - Supported underprivileged children with school fees - Helped facilitate donation drives for the needy







Volunteer – Environmentalist Foundation of India (EFI) - Led community groups for weekly beach and city cleanups - Promoted sustainability and civic responsibility through action






🔑 Leadership Lessons I Live By

Trust leads to empathy
Structure makes action possible
Collaboration results in better outcomes
All of the openings are leadership roles




🚀 Looking Ahead
Growing into an emerging financial leader, my intention is to lead through purpose — blending strategic thinking and people-focused thinking to drive positive change within whatever organization I am part of.
